author: gumb00
content:
In `pectra-devnet-4@v1.0.1` in `invalid_tx_invalid_auth_signature` test, there are `r` and `s` values exceeding 256 bit. Previously state test format required such big int values be represented with special `bigint` notation, see https://ethereum-tests.readthedocs.io/en/latest/test_filler/test_src.html

Is this change in test format on purpose?

author: gumb00
content:
Actually this question is overridden by the following one:

Previously I believe state tests did not include any transaction field values that would make transaction parsing fail, they were tested only with transaction tests, blockchain tests, weren't they? 
now we have tests with too wide values for `r`, `s`, `chain_id`, `nonce` in authorizations, is this change on what state tests allow intentional?

I think this was an oversight! As currently we don't have the transaction format implemented within EEST

For blockchain tests I feel there is "some" value to check block invalidation for these txs, extending to the invalidation of a newPayload, when running the tests within `consume engine` (via hive)
